**Vi söker en kombinerad vaktmästare/IT-ansvarig**


Har du en passion för IT och tycker om att dela med dig av din kunskap? Skulle du vara en bra förebild för våra studenter? Har du goda kunskaper om grundläggande fastighetsunderhåll? Kan du prata både engelska och svenska flytande? Vi rekryterar just nu för en kombinerad IT & vaktmästartjänst.


**Detta är vi!**


Vill du arbeta i en internationell miljö med en stödjande kultur är IES Växjö platsen för dig. Här värnar vi om våra elever genom hela skoldagen och vårt EHT team finns på plats 100% alla dagar i veckan. Vi har en elevgrupp som talar omkring ett 30-tal olika modersmål samt en rik internationell personalgrupp. Läsåret 24/25 har vi cirka 300 elever.


IES Växjö är en tvåspråkig skola. Därför är det viktigt att behärska både svenska och engelska – även skriftligt.


**Detta är du!**


Du är en synlig förebild med stark närvaro i skolans, elevernas och personalen dagliga liv.


Vi söker en lagspelare som är flexibel och trivs med att vara involverad i många områden samtidigt. Du är en positiv person som gör det möjligt för dig att ge bästa möjliga stöd och bygga förtroende inom ICT-området för vår personal och våra elever. Du är serviceinriktad och tar egna initiativ.


Om du har förmågor som entusiastisk, fokuserad och motståndskraftig mot de dagliga påfrestningar som arbete inom utbildning kan medföra är du rätt person för det här arbetet.


**De huvudsakliga ansvarsområdena lokalt omfattar, men är inte begränsade till:**


* Säkerhet på plats för att hålla elever och personal säkra, inklusive att låsa/låsa upp byggnaden vid lämpliga tidpunkter.
* Underhåll av lokalerna för att säkerställa att skolmiljön fungerar smidigt, inklusive underhållsuppgifter, installation och montering av nya produkter.
* Förbereda områden i skolan för aktiviteter, inklusive sammankomster, funktioner, möten etc.
* Medverka vid skydds- och brandskyddsronder
* Implementing and following the IES central IT policy
* Planering och underhåll av IT-resurser (med hjälp av befintliga leverantörer och lösningar)
* IT-support och utbildning (personal och elever)
* Onboarding new staff members
* IT-drift (informera tjänsteleverantörer om problem).
* Posthantering
* Du behöver B-körkort och tillgång till bil


Rollen är spännande och varierande. Du kan komma att hjälpa till i klassrumsmiljö och hålla i workshops och utbildningsmoduler som är skräddarsydda för personal och studenter en dag, medan du fixar möbler nästa dag. Alla våra IT-tjänster tillhandahålls av externa driftpartners som du kommer att ha nära kontakt med för support och underhåll. Vår huvudplattform är Google Workspace for Education.


 Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet. Intervjuer kommer att ske löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Tjänsten är på 100%.


Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt kontakt från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.


About IES


*Internationella Engelska Skolan (IES) is a leading independent school group with academic results far above average and a diverse and energetic staff. Teaching is in both Swedish and English, and the hallways are bilingual. The language of meetings and communication amongst the staff is English.* *IES is one of Sweden's largest school groups at compulsory school level with 48 schools and around 32,000 students across the country. IES has grown steadily and maintained quality since 1993.*

title: School IT
description:
Örebro


School IT


You need to sign in to apply. You can sign in here.
Vacancy details


School Örebro
  

Position School IT
  

Position starts 5 May 2025
  

Publish date 30 January 2025 17:00
  

Closes at 3 March 2025 16:59
  

Contract type Permanent with probation
  

Working hours Full time
  

Working language Swedish and English
  

Contact


Name Elisabeth Pettersson
  

Phone 019- 765 22 40
  

Email elisabeth.pettersson.orebro@engelska.se
  

About this vacancy


IT Representative to Internationella Engelska Skolan in Örebro


IES Örebro is seeking a driven and passionate IT Representative. As an IT Representative you will work closely with the students, teachers and support staff, as well as, be part of the Administration Team. You believe in IES' values and ethos and think that a safe and orderly environment is the key for learning. You are interested in finding solutions for every given situation. As a person you are calm and reliable, but at the same time firm.


You will be responsible for the development and the day to day operation of our IT environment. If you are interested in joining our team, this presents an excellent opportunity for you. At IESÖ your abilities will be given space to grow and develop. The right attitude is important, which is why we are looking for individuals who are enthusiastic, focused, and resilient to the day-to-day pressures that can be expected when working in education.


You will work closely with the Administrative Coordinator and the Administrative team. The IT Representative shall have a clear, positive, and respectful line of communication with the students in order to support and guide them as well as parents and external contractors.


100% Fulltime.


Responsibilities include:

* Implementing and following the IES central IT policy
* Maintaining existing IT systems
* Managing student and staff Chromebooks using Google Workspace
* Providing user support within different IT systems (i.e. Google Workspace, SchoolSoft)
* Repairing broken Chromebooks
* Training staff to use existing and future IT products and services.
* Driving the development of the school through IT solutions
* Managing various webpages, including the staff intranet and a section of Engelska Skolans main website
* Preparing a yearly procurement of devices for both new students and new staff alongside the School Economist
* Onboarding new staff members
* Updating and maintaining the IT inventory
* Liaising with service providers to resolve daily service issues


Knowledge

* Strong understanding of the IES vision, ethos and values


Skills

* Experience working in a team
* Bilingual with English and Swedish(preferred but not essential)
* Experience working with Google services (Drive, Docs, Sheets, etc...)
* Troubleshooting both hardware and software related issues
* Basic customer service skills


As you will be a member of a dynamic school team, you will be expected to take part in school activities, interact with students and parents, and be a true IES Örebro ambassador.


About IES


*Internationella Engelska Skolan (IES) is a leading independent school group with academic results far above average and a diverse and energetic staff. Teaching is in both Swedish and English, and the hallways are bilingual. The language of meetings and communication amongst the staff is English.* *IES is one of Sweden's largest school groups at compulsory school level with 48 schools and around 32,000 students across the country. IES has grown steadily and maintained quality since 1993.*

title: Head of Support
job_function: Customer Service, Quality Assurance, and Strategy/Planning
description:
**Head of Support** 




  





 Bruce Studios is on a mission to provide the #1 fitness app in the world, offering endless exercise in one membership.
 



  





 Are you a leader who thrives on building high-performing teams and delivering exceptional service? Do you have experience scaling support functions while maintaining a strong customer and partner experience? Then come join our team! We are currently looking for a Head of Support in Stockholm, Sweden, to lead and develop our customer and studio support function.
 



  





 This role is responsible for ensuring that both our members and studio partners receive world-class support. You will lead and develop a team that helps our customers with their membership experience while also assisting our studio partners with onboarding, scheduling, and ongoing collaboration. As Head of Support, you will oversee the structure, processes, and quality of our support operations to create an efficient, scalable, and highly responsive function.
 



  





 We currently use Intercom as our support platform, and part of this role will be optimizing its use to improve efficiency and customer experience.
 



  





**What you will do** 



* Lead and develop the support team, ensuring a seamless experience for both customers and studio partners.
* Implement a blended support model that combines AI-powered automation with human expertise to manage high-volume inquiries and complex cases.
* Optimize and scale support workflows to improve efficiency and service quality, identifying opportunities for smarter processes and better tools.
* Define KPIs and continuously refine support strategies based on performance data, customer feedback, and quality standards.
* Represent customer and studio needs internally, ensuring support insights contribute to better services and experiences.
* Train and mentor the support team to ensure continuous development and a strong service culture.
* Oversee and optimize Intercom as the primary support platform, ensuring it is used effectively to improve workflows and customer experience.
* Be hands-on and step in to handle customer or studio cases when needed, ensuring a strong understanding of the team's daily operations.



  





**What we want you to bring** 



* Proven leadership experience within customer support or customer success, ideally in a SaaS environment.
* A strong and inspiring leader with a track record of mentoring, coaching, and developing teams, fostering a supportive and high-performing culture.
* Expertise in integrating AI tools with human-driven support processes to enhance efficiency and customer experience.
* A strategic mindset, with the ability to design and implement scalable support operations that improve efficiency and satisfaction.
* Deep knowledge of customer success metrics, with a data-driven approach to optimizing performance and driving continuous improvement.
* Fluency in English, as well as Swedish, Norwegian, or Danish.
* Strong experience with customer support tools and systems, particularly Intercom, or similar platforms such as Zendesk.
* A Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Customer Service, or a related field (or equivalent experience).



  





**How we think you are** 



* A natural leader who knows how to build and maintain a strong team culture.
* A problem solver who can navigate challenges and implement effective solutions.
* Data-driven, using insights to optimize support functions and decision-making.
* A strong communicator, able to work cross-functionally and align teams toward common goals.
* Passionate about helping others, finding solutions, and creating a great experience for those who need support.
* Organized and structured, with the ability to balance strategic planning with hands-on leadership.
* Comfortable handling customer and studio cases regularly to stay close to operations, understand challenges, and lead by example.



  





**Our values at Bruce Studios** 




 At Bruce Studios, our values guide everything we do—from how we work together to how we engage with our community.
 


* Own it – We take responsibility, make decisions, and follow through. We’re proactive, honest, and always learning from our mistakes.
* Be engaged – We’re all in. We respect each other’s time, stay curious, and continuously strive to improve.
* Be real – Authenticity is key. We communicate openly, support each other, and create a safe space where everyone can be themselves.
* Be adaptable – Change is constant, and we embrace it. We find solutions, stay flexible, and innovate together.
* Be bold – We challenge the status quo, take risks, and push boundaries while treating each other with kindness and respect.



  





**What we offer you** 



* A high-paced environment where you will be able to contribute and make an impact.
* 30 days of vacation.
* Pension benefits.
* Flexible working hours and freedom to shape your way of working.
* Experience working in a fast-growing scale-up.
* A fun, unpretentious, and relaxed team.
* Cooperation across national borders.
* A Bruce Epic membership (of course).



  





**How to apply** 




 Does this sound like the perfect match for you? Apply now! Send your CV in English or Swedish along with a personal letter telling us why you’re excited about this role and how you would contribute to the team. We’d love to hear what motivates you and why Bruce Studios is the right place for you.
 



  





 As diversity is something that is important to us, we’d love to see applicants from all gender identities, ages, cultural backgrounds, and physical abilities.

title: Starta din IT-karriär i Östersund!
description:
Till vår konsultverksamhet i Östersund söker nu Centric flera kunniga, engagerade supporttekniker till en servicedesk. Uppdraget är på heltid och kommer att pågå tills vidare.
   

  

 Låter detta intressant men du saknar boende i Östersund så hjälper vi till med bostad.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Du kommer att arbeta i första linjens support med att hjälpa användare via telefon och/eller mail med IT-relaterade problem. Bland arbetsuppgifterna finns hantering av konton i Active Directory, administration i Microsoft Office 365 och felsökning relaterat till Windowsmiljö samt kundspecifika applikationer. Ditt primära ansvar blir att ge support via telefon, mail och fjärrstyrning. Du kommer även registrera ärenden i ett ärendehanteringssystem.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Du har ett genuint intresse för teknik och en vilja att ge bra service. Du kan förklara IT för personer på olika kunskapsnivåer och är en problemlösare ut i fingerspetsarna. Som person är du social och driven och har gått en IT-inriktning på gymnasiet.
   

  

*Krav*
* Du har gått en IT-inriktning på gymnasiet
* Du har god teknisk kunskap och mycket hög servicekänsla
* Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska flytande


*Meriterande*
* Du har tidigare arbetat eller praktiserat med liknande arbetsuppgifter
* Telefonvana
* Kunskaper inom Active Directory, Microsoft Office 365 och Citrix


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: CloudOps Team Lead
description:
Är du en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist med ledaregenskaper? Vill du driva innovation och effektivitet inom en hybrid molnmiljö? Vi söker en
 **CloudOps Team Lead** 
 till vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm för att leda ett team av skickliga specialister och säkerställa en stabil och modern IT-infrastruktur.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som
 **CloudOps Team Lead** 
 blir du en nyckelperson i vår IT-infrastrukturorganisation. Du kommer att leda och coacha Infrastruktursteamet samtidigt som du ansvarar för drift, utveckling och säkerhet i vår kunds hybridmoln-miljö. Du rapporterar direkt till
 **Head of IT Infrastructure Operations** 
 och samarbetar tätt med övriga IT-funktioner för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och prestanda i våra system.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden**
* Leda och coacha CloudOps-teamet, främja kunskapsdelning och kompetensutveckling.
* Säkerställa stabil drift och affärskontinuitet i en hybrid molnmiljö (Azure, AWS m.fl.).
* Driva tekniska initiativ för digitalisering, automation och serviceoptimering.
* Hantera incidenter, förändringshantering och proaktiv förbättring av IT-infrastruktur.
* Samarbeta med interna intressenter och externa leverantörer för att identifiera och implementera de bästa lösningarna.
* Delta i upphandling, utvärdering och implementering av nya IT-tjänster och verktyg.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk bakgrund inom IT-infrastruktur och molnplattformar samt erfarenhet av att leda och motivera team. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativa uppgifter. Du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och har en naturlig förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med olika delar av organisationen.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att hantera och stödja hybrid multi-molnmiljöer (Azure, AWS, etc.).
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av teamledning eller teknisk projektledning inom IT-infrastruktur.
* Gedigen förståelse för cybersäkerhet, nätverkstjänster, DNS- och PKI-hantering.
* Expertis inom Microsoft-produkter och Enterprise Mobility Management.
* Stark kompetens inom PowerShell-skriptning och automation.
* Erfarenhet av upphandling och leverantörshantering.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vi Erbjuder**
* En nyckelroll i ett teknikdrivet företag med stora möjligheter att påverka.
* Ett samarbetsinriktat team där innovation och utveckling står i fokus.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom moln och infrastruktur.
* En inkluderande och dynamisk arbetsmiljö där vi värdesätter mångfald och personlig utveckling.


**Om CONSULTING It**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Senior Information Security Consultant
description:
**Vill du vara med och bygga ett marknadsledande team inom informationssäkerhet?**
 Nu har du en unik möjlighet att kliva in i en helt ny roll som
 **Senior Information Security Consultant** 
 och bli en del av
 **Cyberdefense at Iver** 
 .
   

  

 Cyberdefense at Iver är den del av Iver som arbetar med utveckling och leverans av avancerade offensiva och defensiva cybersäkerhetstjänster.
   

  

 Vi söker erfarna konsulter som vill vara med och förstärka vår förmåga inom informationssäkerhet, driva utvecklingen inom området och spela en nyckelroll i vår spännande transformationsresa.
   

  

**Om Iver**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.
   

  

 Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden.
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Som
 **Senior Information Security Consultant** 
 får du chansen att påverka och forma informationssäkerhetsområdet inom vår organisation samt vårt erbjudande mot marknaden. I denna roll arbetar du både strategiskt och operativt, med nära kundkontakt och fokus på att hjälpa Iver och Ivers kunder i deras säkerhetsarbete.
   

  

**Det Här Är En Möjlighet Att**
* Vara med från start och sätta ramarna för hur vi arbetar med informationssäkerhet.
* Ta fram strategier kring tjänster inom informationssäkerhet.
* Delta i en transformationsresa där informationssäkerhet är en central del av vår framgång.
* Bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder och bidra till deras säkerhetsstrategier.
* Kombinera teknisk expertis med affärsmannaskap och skapa verkligt värde för våra kunder.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Iver - We empower our Nordic society.**
 På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som
 **Senior Information Security Consultant** 
 kommer du att ha ett brett och varierat ansvarsområde. Du arbetar med rådgivning och stöd inom
 **Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC)** 
 , till riskanalyser, beredskapsplaner driver säkerhetsforum. Allt beroende på din profil och dina intresseområden.
   

  

 Du identifierar, analyserar och hanterar risker samt utvecklar planer för att säkra kontinuitet i kundernas verksamhet. Genom att genomföra säkerhetsgranskningar och revisioner säkerställer du efterlevnad av ledningssystem och säkerhetsstandarder. Vidare arbetar du med att skapa och förbättra styrdokument och strategier som stärker informationssäkerheten hos kunderna.
   

  

 Från att sätta grunden till att förvalta och vidareutveckla informationssäkerhetsområdet inom organisationen, arbetar du nära dina kollegor inom avdelningen Security & Compliance. Genom dialog och samarbete med kunder skapar du skräddarsydda lösningar som uppfyller deras specifika behov. En viktig del av rollen är också att utveckla nya affärsmöjligheter inom informationssäkerhetsområdet, vilket bidrar till verksamhetens tillväxt.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi Söker Dig Som Har En Gedigen Bakgrund Inom Informationssäkerhet Och En Stark Drivkraft Att Vara Med Och Forma Något Nytt. Du Har En Djup Förståelse För Tekniska Säkerhetslösningar, Nätverkssäkerhet Och Systemarkitektur. Dessutom Har Du Erfarenhet Av Att Arbeta Med Verktyg Och Plattformar För Riskhantering Och Säkerhetsövervakning, Samt Förmågan Att Genomföra Tekniska Säkerhetsgranskningar Och Utforma Effektiva Säkerhetslösningar. Du Har Troligen
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom informationssäkerhet, cybersäkerhet eller närliggande områden.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC).
* Bakgrund inom teknisk säkerhet, inklusive riskhantering och säkerhetsgranskningar.
* Erfarenhet av ISO-standarder (främst ISO 27001) och deras tillämpning i praktiken.
* Förmåga att leda implementeringsprojekt och agera rådgivande i komplexa säkerhetsfrågor.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska , både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av juridiska aspekter av informationssäkerhet, t.ex. GDPR eller andra regleringar.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning eller transformationsprojekt inom informationssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av att utbilda och coacha kollegor eller kunder i säkerhetsfrågor.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
 Som Person ser vi att du ha en stark kommunikativ förmåga och en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende hos både kunder och andra intressenter. Du är affärsorienterad och har erfarenhet av att identifiera och driva nya affärsmöjligheter inom informationssäkerhet.
   

  

 Du arbetar strukturerat och analytiskt med ett problemlösningsorienterat arbetssätt, vilket gör att du effektivt kan hantera komplexa säkerhetsutmaningar. Dessutom har du förmågan att kombinera teknisk kompetens med ett strategiskt och operativt perspektiv, vilket gör att du kan bidra både på djup teknisk nivå och med övergripande säkerhetsstrategier.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från vårt kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Övrig Information**
 Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-31. Du är välkommen att kontakta Thandi Schüler, thandi.schuler@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Iver!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: IT Operations Project Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We are seeking a versatile IT Operations Project Manager with experience in Microsoft 365 and Azure to join our team. The ideal candidate will be capable of running multiple projects in parallel, coordinating with various teams, and being hands-on with technical tasks. This role requires a proactive individual who can structure projects, manage timelines, and ensure effective communication across departments.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Project Management: Lead and manage multiple IT projects simultaneously, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.
* Technical Expertise: Actively support projects with hands-on activities and knowledge.
* Coordination: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, sales, HR, and customer service, to ensure seamless project execution.
* Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and risk assessments.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* Proven experience in IT operations management, preferably with a background in Microsoft 365 and Azure.
* Strong understanding of IT service management (ITSM) principles and best practices.
* Excellent leadership and team management skills with a proactive and engaging approach.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, promoting collaboration and understanding across diverse teams.


**Preferred Skills:**
* Experience with cloud platforms, network administration, and server management.
* Familiarity with IT security measures and compliance standards.
* Ability to work across different locations and time zones.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**Are you a problem-solving, customer-focused professional with a passion for financial planning?**
 Do you enjoy helping companies optimize their budgeting and forecasting processes while working in a dynamic and social role?
   

  

 We are growing and looking for more driven and engaged
 **Customer Success Managers** 
 to join us on our exciting journey!
   

  

**Planacy is looking for you!**
****– A relationship-driven Customer Success Manager****
 We are an ambitious SaaS company in an exciting phase of expansion. With a powerful
 **Financial Planning & Analytics (FP&A)** 
 platform, we have established ourselves as
 **Nordic's leading solution for data-driven budgeting, forecasting, and planning.** 
 Our platform helps companies simplify and streamline their financial processes, enabling them to become more successful.
   

  

 With nearly 200 customers, including
 **Trustly, Rejlers, Billogram, Foodora, Fjällräven and Netlight** 
 , we have already demonstrated the value of our product. Now, it's time to scale even further!
   

  

 Sweden is our home ground, Scandinavia our market – but our goal is to
 **become a European leader in FP&A.** 
 To achieve this, we need
 **you** 
 to join our highly motivated, competent, and committed team. Together, we will realize our vision: to contribute to better-planned, more data-driven, and more successful companies.
   

  

**Who are you?**
****– A problem-solver with a passion for customer success!****
 You might have a background in
 **business controlling, finance, customer success, or account management** 
 and now want to apply your skills in a more social and strategic role. You love helping customers succeed, optimizing processes, and working with innovative technology. You are communicative, structured, proactive, and passionate about delivering value.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Planacy, you will work closely with a team of financial planning experts and technical specialists to ensure that our customers
 **maximize the value of our platform.** 
 Your role will include:
   

  

 ✔
 **Relationship Management** 
 – Act as the trusted advisor for CFOs, Business Controllers, and Finance Teams.
   

  

 ✔
 **Customer
 **Retention** 
 & Growth** 
 – Identify upsell and expansion opportunities to help customers get even more value from Planacy.
   

  

 ✔
 **Customer Onboarding & Training** 
 – Guide new customers through implementation and ensure they quickly see value in the platform.
   

  

 ✔
 **Process Optimization** 
 – Help customers design optimal budgeting and forecasting workflows.
   

  

 ✔
 **Customer Insights & Feedback** 
 – Gather customer feedback to improve our product and enhance user experience.
   

  

 This is a
 **social, business-driven, and strategic role** 
 where you will work closely with both our
 **sales team and technical experts** 
 , ensuring customer satisfaction and long-term success.
   

  

**Your qualities**
 🔹 Motivated and passionate about customer success
   

  

 🔹 Structured and thorough in your approach
   

  

 🔹 Strong communicator and educator
   

  

 🔹 Fluent in
 **written and spoken English & Swedish**
 🔹 Passionate about
 **financial planning, analytics, and technology**
**Bonus Qualifications (nice-to-have But Not Required)**
 ✅ Experience working with
 **financial planning, business controlling, or SaaS**
 ✅ Familiarity with
 **balance sheets, cash flow, and financial forecasting**
 ✅ Interest in software, automation, and data-driven decision-making
   

  

**Why join Planacy?**
* Be part of a fast-growing SaaS company with ambitious goals
* Make a real impact – your role will directly influence our customers' success
* A collaborative and social work environment in central Stockholm
* Opportunities for growth and development as we scale across Europe


**Flexible work environment and good employment conditions**
 At Planacy, all employees play a key role and have a significant impact on the product and the company’s development. We have a passion for what we do. We have fun together and celebrate our success with shuffleboard, sparkling wine, burgers and a well-stocked beer fridge – as well as with a week-long annual Take Off to a pleasant destination (usually in southern Europe).
   

  

 We are convinced that if the team – that makes our success possible – continuously evolves and are happy and healthy, the success will be all the greater. We therefore offer a high level of trust and we value commitment and a high level of responsibility.
   

  

**We Offer**
* Flexible work environment 🕐
* Competitive salary (fixed + variable) 💰
* 6 weeks of vacation 🏄🏻‍♀️
* A very good retirement plan 👵🏼
* Comprehensive health insurance 💙
* Annually one week team Take Off 🏖 🕺
* + additional benefits


 At Planacy, every team member plays a key role in shaping our success. We celebrate wins together – whether it's through
 **Friday burgers, after-work drinks, or our annual Take Off trip to southern Europe.**
**Apply now!**
 Are you excited about working in a
 **high-growth SaaS company** 
 and helping companies succeed with financial planning?
 **We’d love to meet you!** 
 Apply by sending your
 **CV and a short cover letter** 
 .

title: Projektledare hos Chief Västerås
description:
*Är du en driven projektledare som söker nya utmaningar i Västerås? Hos oss på Chief får du chansen att leda spännande projekt inom teknik och utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsplats där innovation, samarbete och personlig utveckling står i fokus.*
****Din roll som projektledare****
 Som projektledare hos oss har du en nyckelroll i att driva och genomföra tekniska projekt från start till mål. Du ansvarar för att leda projektteam, koordinera resurser och säkerställa att projekt levereras enligt uppsatta mål vad gäller kvalitet, tid och budget. Med din tekniska bakgrund och ditt strategiska tänkande säkerställer du att projekt utvecklas i rätt riktning, samtidigt som du skapar engagemang och samverkan mellan olika intressenter.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta inom olika branscher såsom hållbar energi, fordonsindustrin, IT och industri. För att du ska kunna utvecklas i din roll satsar vi på din personliga tillväxt genom mentorskapsprogram, skräddarsydda utbildningar och individuell coaching.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker en tekniskt kunnig och lösningsorienterad projektledare med erfarenhet av att driva komplexa projekt. Du har en stark analytisk förmåga, god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs i en roll där du får ta ansvar och fatta strategiska beslut.
   

  

**Vi Ser Att Du Har**
* En ingenjörsexamen.
* Minst 6 års erfarenhet av att leda projekt inom teknik.
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vilka är Chief?**
 Vi Är Ett Entreprenörsdrivet Konsultbolag Med Fokus På Teknik Och Ledarskap – Oavsett Bransch. Vi Erbjuder Dig Ett Familjärt Sammanhang Där Fokus Ligger På
   

  

* Valfrihet & anpassning: Som ett personligt bolag anpassar vi oss efter dig som individ, i allt från anställningserbjudande till din framtida karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder skräddarsydda utbildningar och certifieringar samt tre olika förmånspaket där vi anpassar förmåner och lön efter just din livssituation.
* Gemenskap & utveckling: Personlig- och ledarskapsutveckling i form av mentorskapsprogram, Chief Academy samt andra spännande interna initiativ.


**Redo att utvecklas tillsammans med oss? - Härligt!** 
**😊**
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev, eller något annat innovativt som uppfyller samma syfte. Intervjuer och återkoppling sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om Chief och rollen så kontakta gärna mig så berättar jag mer!
   

  

 Sasha Schagerström, Titel
   

  

 Telefon: 0736329308

title: IT Sourcing Manager
description:
**The Role**
 As IT Sourcing Manager, you will develop and execute global strategies that reduce IT costs, improve services, and strengthen the supply chain for IT and telecom goods across DeLaval. You will manage sourcing and contracting for all IT sub-categories, focus on application management related matters.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Conduct sub-category analysis and market research to maintain up-to-date sourcing knowledge.
* Negotiate and manage commercial contract terms in collaboration with the legal department.
* Lead competitive bidding processes (RFI, RFP) and ensure alignment with business requirements.
* Support IT Security and Legal teams to ensure services and solutions comply with company standards.
* Oversee contract renewals and terminations, ensuring proactive management.
* Identify cost-saving opportunities and negotiate favorable terms for DeLaval.
* Manage supplier relationships, monitor performance, and provide feedback.
* Coordinate sourcing initiatives with other industry groups (Tetra Pak, Sidel).
* Implement procurement strategies and update policies as needed.


**Experience And Competence**
 To succeed in this role, you should have several years of IT sourcing and contracting experience, ideally within multinational organizations. You should demonstrate strong negotiation skills and be comfortable managing global projects and supplier relationships. Experience in IT outsourcing environments is a plus. You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
* Has strong experience in IT sourcing, including category management and change management.
* Can collaborate with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
* Has a proven ability to influence senior management and negotiate with global IT vendors.
* Holds a Master's degree in Business Administration, IT, or a related field, with at least 5 years of relevant experience.
* Is fluent in English and comfortable working in a global environment.


**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We Offer You a Workplace Like No Other, Where State-of-the-art Technology Goes Hand In Hand With Animal Welfare. DeLaval Is a Part Of The Tetra Laval Group Together With Tetra Pak And Sidel. In Addition, We Offer
   

  

* A secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance, parental leave, reduction of working hours).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness contribution of 4 000 SEK/year.
* Private health insurance.
* Flexible working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. You will report to the Director of Global Indirect Sourcing. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely; however, employees are expected to be in the office at least three days per week.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Katarzyna Fabianska Katarzyna.Fabianska@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Head of Software Engineering and Architecture - Autonomous
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

 Einride is seeking a visionary Head of Software Engineering & Architecture to lead the development of our autonomous transport solutions. You'll drive technical excellence, optimize processes, and scale high-performing teams in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
   

  

**You will:**
* Define and evolve software architecture aligned with product goals
* Implement lean engineering practices to enhance quality and reliability
* Oversee autonomous software development, including next-gen advancements
* Optimize CI/CD pipelines and simulation-based verification
* Lead and mentor engineering teams, fostering innovation and technical excellence
* Establish agile methodologies, compliance roadmaps, and key performance metrics


**We expect you to have:**
* Extensive leadership experience driving success in high-growth tech environments
* Proven experience in autonomous or automotive software development
* Proficiency in applicable standards like ISO 26262, ASPICE and functional safety
* Strong strategic thinking, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills
* Fluent in English


 This is a full-time position based in Gothenburg or Stockholm. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
   

  

 Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: Business Team Leader | Stockholm
description:
*Vill du ta nästa kliv i karriären och utvecklas som ledare? Brinner du för att bygga team, skapa långsiktiga relationer och utveckla affärer? Nu har du chansen att forma din egen resa som* 
*Business Team Leader hos oss, där du kommer spela en central roll i både teamet och bolaget.*
**Rollen Som Business Team Leader**
 Med ett ben i rekrytering, kommer du att
 **bygga upp och leda ditt eget team av konsulter** 
 , där du aktivt deltar i rekryteringsprocessen för att attrahera rätt talanger. Med ett annat ben i sälj, fokuserar du på att
 **bygga nätverk, identifiera affärsmöjligheter och etablera starka kundrelationer.** 
 Du kommer att arbeta nära ledningsgruppen och få insyn i bolagets strategiska utveckling och få möjlighet att påverka riktningen framåt.
   

  

 Samtidigt som du har en nyckelroll internt, kommer du själv att få arbeta som konsult och vara ansiktet utåt hos någon av våra kunder. Inom ett år förväntas du ha byggt upp ett starkt team med cirka tio konsulter, och successivt kliva ur kunduppdragen för att fokusera på att driva dina egna affärer.
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som trivs i en dynamisk och högpresterande miljö med höga förväntningar, men också
 **rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas.** 
 På sikt, med stöd från oss andra i bolaget och en stor dos eget driv, är målet att du tar över ansvaret för en egen affärsenhet som Business Unit Manager.
   

  

**Vad Vi Söker Hos Dig**
 Vi söker dig som är en naturlig ledare och som får energi av att bygga och utveckla – både människor och affärer. Du har en hög ambitionsnivå, där du
 **tar ägandeskap och driver saker framåt** 
 .
   

  

 Att skapa och underhålla relationer faller sig naturligt för dig, och du har lätt för att bygga förtroende hos både kunder och kollegor. Vidare har du ett kommunikativt och prestigelöst sätt, som kombinerat med din positiva energi gör dig till en uppskattad ledare och samarbetspartner.
   

  

 Om du är en person som gillar att tänka stort, ta initiativ och vill utveckla både dig själv och företaget, kan detta vara helt rätt möjlighet för dig!
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du**
* Har ett starkt eget driv och gillar att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö.
* Är civil- eller högskoleingenjör.
* Har 2-6 års arbetsliverfarenhet.
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska.


*Erfarenhet av konsultbranschen eller ett befintligt nätverk inom IT och teknik är mycket meriterande.*
**Vilka är Chief?**
 Vi Är Ett Entreprenörsdrivet Konsultbolag Med Fokus På Teknik Och Ledarskap – Oavsett Bransch. Vi Erbjuder Dig Ett Familjärt Sammanhang Där Fokus Ligger På
   

  

* Valfrihet & anpassning: Som ett personligt bolag anpassar vi oss efter dig som individ, i allt från anställningserbjudande till din framtida karriärutveckling. Vi erbjuder skräddarsydda utbildningar och certifieringar samt tre olika förmånspaket där vi anpassar förmåner och lön efter just din livssituation.
* Gemenskap & utveckling: Personlig- och ledarskapsutveckling i form av mentorskapsprogram, Chief Academy samt andra spännande interna initiativ.


**Redo att utvecklas tillsammans med oss? - Härligt!** 
**😊**
 Skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev, eller något annat innovativt som uppfyller samma syfte. Intervjuer och återkoppling sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Brand Manager Ben & Jerry's Nordics
company_industry: Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
**Looking for Your Dream Job? Join Our Ben & Jerry’s Team as Nordic Brand Manager!**
**Function:** 
 Marketing
   

  

**Scope:** 
 Local
   

  

**Reports to:** 
 Nordic Lead, Emelie Henning
   

  

**Location:** 
 Preferred: Solna, Sweden // Possible: Other Nordic country
   

  

**Terms & Conditions:** 
 Fixed-term role, estimated until the end of 2025, no relocation support
   

  

****ABOUT Ben & Jerry’s****
 Ben & Jerry’s was founded in 1978 in a renovated gas station in Burlington Vermont, USA by childhood friends & dedicated activists Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield. They took a $5 correspondence course in ice cream making from Penn State University and with a $12,000 investment ($4,000 was borrowed), they began their business making the finest quality ice cream with big chunks and swirls. They operated the company on a sustainable concept of linked prosperity and a 3-part mission where product, economic and social objectives carried equal importance.
   

  

 Today, Ben & Jerry’s is a global business and a key premium brand in the total European Ice Cream portfolio at Unilever, who acquired B&J’s in 2000. Nordics is one of the largest clusters in EU and has an important role in shaping B&J’s European strategy.
   

  

 Ben & Jerry’s and our delicious ice cream Pints have long been established as the perfect partner for your sofa night with your favorite film. We have a huge ambition to drive the growth of the brand all whilst continuing to drive our Three Part Mission to achieve positive social impact through our business.
   

  

****JOB PURPOSE:****
 Are you a passionate, business articulate marketer who shares our core belief in values-based business? Do you have an appetite to drive transformational growth by leading this fantastic brand? Then this role is tailored for you.
   

  

****KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:****
 You would have responsibility to lead and deliver for Ben and Jerry’s three-part mission (Economic, Product, Social) through your innovation projects and your management of the product portfolio. The role involves:
   

  

* Build brand plans based on market insights, consumer and shopper trends, NRM principles, channel insight and competitor understanding.
* Day-to-day product portfolio management, including monitoring/reporting of in-market performance.
* Continuous optimization of Nordic product portfolio based on in-market performance.
* Launching new innovations. Building Business Cases and driving projects through Investor Board Process working closely with B&J’s EU team & customer development teams.
* Ownership of P&L for your B&J’s projects.
* POS visibility custodian for B&J’s – liaising with the Marketing activation managers across Nordics and B&J EU’s & Global teams on designs and guidelines for POS and other assets.
* Artwork Champion for B&J’s Nordics, managing the artwork approval process for the local team in conjunction with the B&J’s European development team.
* Monitor and review effectiveness of innovation and renovation programme to inform future plans.
* Ensure eCom content is optimized.
* Analyse the market, consumer and shopper trends & competitor understanding. Support management with insights as a base for Brand audits and to contribute to B&J’s long term Brand strategy.
* Collaborate with Category managers & CMI to create Trade presentations
* As a Brand Manager, you will engage in continuous cross-functional stakeholder management across Ice Cream Nordics, and establish a close partnership with fellow team members, not only in B&J’s Nordic & EU teams, but also with B&J’s Global digital & media teams based in Vermont, US.
* Most importantly you will be tasting brand new Ice Cream flavours! Because as Jerry once said, ‘if it’s not fun… Why do it?’


****WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:****
* Entrepreneurial spirit, growth and ‘let’s do it’ mindset – someone who seeks out the opportunities.
* Strong business acumen with a desire for empowerment to develop and build plans.
* Strong project management skills – capable of confidently guiding cross-functional, project teams.
* Passionate, optimistic, and articulate marketer with high affinity to Ben & Jerry’s and the companies’ values.
* Strong P&L and Business Case understanding.
* IT literacy & Nielsen understanding
* Language requirements English: Other Nordic language skills are seen as a plus.


****RELEVANT EXPERIENCE****
* 1-3 years brand management experience in an FMCG environment.
* Experience from portfolio management and innovation/product launch.
* Business management experience (basic financials e.g. P&L).
* Understanding of the Nordic retailer landscape, incl. e-commerce would be preferred.


****ADDITIONAL INFORMATION****
 This is a parental leave cover and the start date is April 2025 or as soon as possible, we will proceed with interviews asap. This role will preferably be based in Solna, Sweden, but other Nordic countries can be considered. To be taken into consideration for this role, you will need to hold a valid working permit for Sweden (or the other Nordic country where you would be based).
   

  

**ARE YOU EXCITED TO CRAFT BEN & JERRY’S FUTURE?**
 Please apply via this portal latest on March 12th. E-mail applications will not be processed.
   

  

 We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment journey. Should you require additional information or reasonable adjustments to allow you to present your best self during this process, please contact HR operations specialist Rosanna Valtonen at rosanna.valtonen@unilever.com.
   

  

****ADDITIONAL INFORMATION****
 Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
   

  

 We take pleasure seriously. Join the Ice Cream Ben & Jerry’s team now!
   

  

 Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: Business Development & Engineering Manager
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 We are looking to recruit a Business Development and Engineering (BDE) Manager to fill a key role in our Upplands Väsby (UV) plant.
   

  

 If you are a driven leader with multi-level stakeholder influencing skills, this position will give you unique exposure to both Manufacturing and Category growth, taking your career to the next level.
   

  

 The BDE Manager is a senior strategic role based in our UV plant. As a key member of the Plant Leadership Team, you will be directly responsible for the delivery of the BDE agenda for the plant, managing, coordinating, and overseeing I2M and IIM processes ensuring effective planning and execution of change as it relates to new and existing products, packaging and processes.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
 You will:
   

  

* Lead and champion Site Engineering best practices utilizing IL6S and I2M/IM methodologies.
* Lead the roll out of the IIM pillar in support of the overall implantation of IL6S
* Define and agree Capital Investment plans, and lead capital spend and phasing across the cluster.
* Provide mid/long term capacity planning at plant level to enable overall network capacity planning.
* Execute capital projects. Right First Time, with Vertical Start Ups to the highest standard of Safety and Quality.
* Support Site Strategic Plan / Annual Contract creation: Support the Plant Leadership team in developing the site strategy and plant road map.
* Lead, coach and develop the talent of the local BDE organisation.
* Provide effective conversion change coordination including project costing, timing and capital requirements, applying engineering best practices, most efficient use of plant capability and capacity while maintaining high-level customer service.
* Ownership for setting and delivering the UV site roadmap for recipe, plant layout and infrastructure, engaging and influencing key stakeholders as required. You will also develop Global and Regional links to benchmark and drive improvement for key manufacturing technologies.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
   

  

* Strong operational & manufacturing experience in CPG industry with experience in TPM-Total productive maintenance, 5s, LEAN, 6 sigma tools and concepts, Safety & GMP standard.
* Good understanding of end-to-end processes in the manufacturing and business environment; working knowledge of commercialization process (I2M); project leadership / management skills and technical and financial aspects of the business.
* Strategic thinking, while having ability to excel in leading tactical programs.
* Highly action oriented, drive for results, innovative, challenging actual set-ups, entrepreneurial ability.
* Excellent communication (verbal & written), coaching, and leadership skills in a team-based environment.
* Demonstrated abilities in analytics, problem solving and team building.
* Possess excellent interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively with colleagues at all levels of the organization.


**Education and Experience:**
* University education in Engineering.
* Fundamental know-how and experience in food processes and products required.
* Good knowledge of technical and financial affairs required.
* Experience within production and working experience managing teams/projects.
* Extensive experience within Engineering
* Strong people management skills required.
* Strong communication and negotiation skills to manage cross-functional interfaces required.
* Analytical and conceptual skills required.
* Strong project management and organisational skills required.
* New product launch, commercialisation, and I2M process skills.
* Idea Leadership, Business Acumen preferred.


**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Project Engineering
   

  

 Science & Engineering

title: Lead Auditor - Information Security ISO 27001
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Business Assurance**
 We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a result of further growth of our Business Assurance Unit in Sweden we are looking for qualified
 **Lead Auditors** 
 within the
 **Information Security ISO 27001** 
 area, preferably combined with ISO 9001.
   

  

**Your place of employment can be anywhere in Sweden, with visits to the client site.**
 As a
 **Lead Auditor** 
 you will be part of our team of auditors. Your assignments will be performing audits according to standards for information security – normally at the customer’s premises - in a wide variety of industries.
   

  

 You will be part of a professional team of colleagues with experience in many industries. As a Lead Auditor you will work both independently and in multidisciplinary teams.
   

  

**The Assignment May Include**
* Performing audits for Swedish and international clients
* Project management of larger certification projects
* Development of new services, training services, etc. on an ad hoc basis
* Supporting sales team and contributing to sales revenue.


 What we offer
   

  

 In DNV we are proud to lead the development in our main industries. Whether we work with some of the world’s leading companies to help solve some of their risk or safety challenges or we initiate joint industry projects to solve an industry-wide technical issue, we always aim to deliver expert insight and value to our customers and stakeholders. You will work with experts from a wide range of disciplines and build your competence, problem-solving abilities. It will broaden your view.
   

  

**We offer**
* A strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* Attractive total compensation package
* International working environment
* Flexible working hours and focus on work/life balance
* Interesting and challenging customers and projects, both national and international
* Be part of a world-leading company that has a global reach with more than 12 000 employees around to world and is headquartered in Norway.
* The possibility to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV.


**Requirements**
 About you
   

  

* Relevant educational background
* At least four years full-time practical work experience in information technology, of which at least two years in a role or function relating to information security
* Experience with one or more of the following standards: ISO 27001 and ISO 9001 and knowledge of best practices regarding information security.
* ISO 22301 - Business continuity and ISO 20000 - Service Management is not a requirement but is an advantage.
* Good communication and collaborative skills
* Must be able to travel, including overnight stays, often involving travel outside of normal working hours
* Good English skills in speech and writing, as well as fluent in Swedish, both in speech and writing
* Great commercial and sales skills preferred
* Strong communication and training skills preferred.


**Personal qualities**
* Are organized, service-minded, and focused on timely delivery with the right quality
* Are both a team player as well as self-reliant
* Like working in an international organization
* Are business- and customer-oriented
* Good communication and commercial skills, able to choose appropriate methods and style to suit the situation and audience.


 For more details about this role please contact: Patrik Flink, Operations Manager, Sweden at +46 708 301 683
   

  

 Please submit your CV in English or Swedish.
   

  

 Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Please be informed you may be requested to provide DNV with additional documents for a background check.

title: Customer Success Manager (CSM)
description:
**Who We Are**
 Doctrin's purpose has been clear since our start: to radically improve healthcare. We achieve this by intelligently digitalizing the patient journey, allowing healthcare providers to prioritize, treat, and follow up with patients securely online. At Doctrin, we value diversity of minds, different backgrounds, and perspectives, uniting around our mission to positively impact the world.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Customer Success Manager (CSM), your primary task is to create added value for Doctrin’s customers. This includes everything from successful implementation and supporting onboarding for new customers and organizations to proactively identifying customers in need of additional assistance and opportunities for upselling and expansion. The Customer Success team works to increase customer satisfaction, reduce churn risk, and ensure a smooth start for new customers on their digiphysical journey.
   

  

**What are the main responsibilities of a Customer Success Manager?**
**Responsibilities**
 The role of a Customer Success Manager at Doctrin involves overseeing the entire customer journey from the moment a customer chooses Doctrin. It is a highly proactive role, requiring a strong understanding of customer needs and the ability to address them even before customers reach out. Below are some of the key responsibilities:
   

  

*Onboarding and implementation*
 You are an expert on Doctrin’s platform and understand how it can be tailored to help each organization achieve its digitalization goals, improve patient journeys, and enhance the work environment for employees. You share best practices and provide custom recommendations regarding usage, configuration, and workflows to maximize the value of Doctrin’s platform.
   

  

*Building and nurturing customer relationships*
 You are service-oriented and attentive to understand customers’ needs and challenges. Customers should feel they are getting the best experience with Doctrin, and you will propose tailored solutions that fit their unique requirements.
   

  

*Proactively working with customers*
 A CSM continuously monitors customer activity levels to offer solutions tailored to their current needs. This also involves anticipating future needs and proactively presenting ideas and suggestions to customers. Keeping up with market trends and developments is crucial to providing better solutions for the future.
   

  

*Identifying upselling opportunities*
 As a Customer Success Manager, you guide customers throughout their journey. While ensuring they continue using Doctrin is key, identifying upselling opportunities, such as offering complementary products or services, is equally important.
   

  

*Collecting and analyzing customer feedback*
 As a CSM, you continuously track customer satisfaction, analyze data and reviews, and identify risks or areas for improvement.
   

  

*Represent the customer and customer needs internally at Doctrin*
 You will be the spokesperson for Doctrin’s customers internally, giving input and feedback to other departments in Doctrin on how we can best meet current and future customer needs.
   

  

 As a CSM at Doctrin, you are responsible for creating loyal, returning customers who not only continue using Doctrin’s platform but also purchase new functionalities and become brand ambassadors, recommending the company to others.
   

  

**What is required to succeed in this role?**
 To thrive as a Customer Success Manager at Doctrin, you should have a passion for and experience in sales, project management, and customer service. Strong problem-solving skills, creativity, and a proactive mindset are key, as is the ability to stay one step ahead—anticipating customer needs and distinguishing between what they want and what will truly benefit them.
   

  

 We are looking for candidates with a master’s degree (or at least a bachelor’s) in engineering, business & economics, medicine (MD), or nursing (RN). Fluency in Swedish and professional-level English is also required.
   

  

 Additionally, experience with digital health platforms, implementing healthcare technology, project management, and driving clinical change is highly valued. Understanding how to support organizational transformation within healthcare environments will be a strong advantage in this role.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
 Besides a strongly purpose-driven job with passionate, humble, and welcoming colleagues at the forefront of the new healthcare, we offer a hybrid way of working in dialogue with your closest manager and team, with access to our office in central Stockholm.
   

  

**So, what do you say?**
 If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, come and work with us, and let’s do this together.
   

  

**What happens now?**
 The process begins with your application via the link in this ad. We carefully review all applications and select candidates who best match the requirements.
   

  

 If Selected, You Will Be Invited To An Initial Brief Call With The Hiring Manager Or The HR Business Partner. This Is Followed By Interviews Focusing On Different Key Areas, Including
   

  

* Cultural fit with Doctrin
* Background and competencies
* Language proficiency
* Problem-solving skills
* As part of the selection process, you may also be asked to complete a case or assessment to showcase your skills and approach to solving challenges.


 For questions about the process, contact the responsible recruiter: camila.widmark@doctrin.se. For questions about the position and tasks, contact the recruiting manager: hani.ashkar@doctrin.se.
   

  

 Follow Doctrin AB on LinkedIn to find news and other available positions.

title: Solution Architect
description:
Are you a dynamic and experienced Solution Architect with a passion for collaborating towards success in a high-tech, innovative environment? Join our forward-thinking Solution Architect team at ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, based in Stockholm, Sweden. You'll be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Solution Architect**
 You would be responsible for designing and implementing scalable, secure, and reliable solution architectures to address our evolving business needs. This role involves close collaboration with development teams, system architects, vendors, and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Develop end-to-end IoT solution architectures that address current and future business requirements, including data collection from sensors, equipment, and appliances.
* Design and implement cutting-edge technology solutions that align with ASSA ABLOY's business goals and objectives.
* Assess existing systems and technologies to identify areas for improvement and provide technical expertise and recommendations to stakeholders.
* Monitor emerging technology trends and proactively suggest innovative solutions to enhance our capabilities.
* Conduct technical due diligence to support the M&A team in evaluating potential acquisitions.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Solution Architect in industrial products, IoT cloud environments, data and analytics architectures, or a similar field.
* Proven expertise in designing and implementing scalable, secure solutions in cloud environments, with hands-on experience in IoT-based wireless technologies such as ZigBee, BLE, and similar protocols.
* A strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) methodologies.
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and the ability to lead cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and budget.
* A bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.


 Ideally, you also have relevant certifications in AWS or Azure or have experience in M&A and in the hospitality industry.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, please email Alexandra Kymäläinen, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at alexandra.kymalainen@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
