title: Integrations Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**


We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.


Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

 **THE ROLE**


We are seeking a talented and experienced Integrations Specialist to join our small and highly skilled team. Being a part of our team offers you the freedom and trust to take your own initiatives and plan your work accordingly. We believe in empowering our team members to make decisions and take ownership of their projects. This autonomy allows you to explore innovative solutions and contribute to the success of our organization in a meaningful way. You will have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment where your ideas are valued, and you can grow both personally and professionally. You will have the opportunity to work in a company and with a high volume integration platform handling millions of Ecom transactions on a yearly basis, in several countries and across 2 continents.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and implement complex integration solutions using a Cloud Based Integration Platform (C# based framework)
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze integration requirements.
* Plan, develop, implement and maintain system integrations (For example Ecom/WMS/ERP).
* Document integration processes and provide technical guidance to internal stakeholders.
* As a part of a highly skilled and dedicated team, be involved in improving processes and way of working.
* Be part of ensuring the scalability, stability, long-term development and planning of a modern integration platform.

 **WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU**


We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, people-first environment and is excited to build great stuff. Here’s what will help you succeed:

* Solid experience in developing and implementing complex integration solutions.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.
* Solid programming skills.

**Nice to have**

* Proficiency in C#.
* Experience working with the cloud-based integrations systems.
* Experience with integrations towards ERP, WMS, and Ecom systems.
* Proficiency with SQL databases.

 **WHAT WE OFFER**


We are a value driven company with our values *We team up*, *Innovation Drives Us*, *Inclusion & Non-Hierarchy* and *Going the Extra Mile* at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.


Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings

 **SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**


If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!


Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.


If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Test Automation Engineer - Lund/Gothenburg/Ottawa
description:
**What makes us Qlik****?**  

A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 14 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.  

We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities.**Software Test Automation Engineer****role:**

  

You will join the GeoAnalytics & Mobile team which develops state of the art visualizations and geographic features analytics capabilities in Qlik Sense and native Mobile application.
  

  

You will join Qlik as a Software Test Automation Engineer, with focus and Mobile where you will be an integral part of our R&D team. **What makes this role interesting?**  

You will constantly evolve and learn new things. You create and release small increments of value, with quality, multiple times per day.

* Innovative Projects: You'll be testing and maintaining mobile applications that are integral to our product offerings, working with the latest technologies to ensure high performance and responsiveness.
* Collaborative Environment: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, architects, and designers, to bring new features to life and ensure a seamless user experience.
* Agile Principles: Thrive in a team that values agile methodologies, encourages diverse perspectives, and fosters a welcoming and supportive atmosphere.
* Continuous Learning: Stay ahead of the curve by continuously discovering, evaluating, and implementing new technologies to enhance development efficiency.

 **Here’s how you’ll be making an impact:**  

We are primarily a full-stack team and looking for a Software Test Automation Engineer with focus on Mobile. You will work tightly with highly engaged co-workers in your team with a lot of responsibility and influence. We take pride in testing and quality.

 **Strategic Testing:** Review market requirements, functional specifications, and detailed design documents to derive comprehensive test objectives, ensuring the quality of our products. **Automated Testing:** Design and implement automated test scenarios, execute automated test suites, and analyze results to enhance testing efficiency. **Manual Testing:** Design and execute manual test cases as needed, aligning with test objectives, and contributing to a robust testing framework. **Framework Contribution:** Contribute to the maintenance and further development of the test automation framework, ensuring its effectiveness and relevance.  

System Maintenance: Bootstrap, configure, populate, and maintain test systems with third-party data sources for both automated and manual testing purposes. **We’re looking for a teammate with** **the following experience****:**  

* Bachelor degree in Computer Science (or equivalent)
* At least 3years of experience in Mobile Testing
* Experience in native apps in Android and iOS.
* Experience working with CI/CD pipelines.
* An immensely curious and collaborative team player who wants to learn and grow, and put their hand in the air for projects and share new ideas
* 2-3 or more years of test automation experience, demonstrating a strong foundation in ensuring product quality.
* Experience using scripting languages, particularly JavaScript, to create testing tools and automation.
* Ability to analyze functional test plans, deriving thorough, optimal, and complete automation objectives.
* Ability to understand the technical design of the automation framework and formulate innovative ideas for its extension.
* Some experience using Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and/or Microsoft Azure is preferred.
* Excellent verbal and written English skills as the company language is English.
* Leverage your ability to create valuable relationships

 **Th****e****l****ocation** **for this role is****:**  

This position is in Lund/Gothenburg/Ottawa. You will work in a team with colleagues both onsite and remote. Work-life balance is something we value at Qlik.

 **Apply now and j****oin us on this exciting journey, where your contributions will not only drive projects forward but also play a vital role in the continuous improvement initiatives that define Qlik's success in the industry.** **More about Qlik and who we are****:**  

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our Careers Page.  

What else do we offer?  

* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment

  

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs ***If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via*** ***email to accessibilityta@qlik.com******.*** ***Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s*** ***Recruitment Privacy Notice******. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.***  

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.
company_description: Qlik is a global software company headquartered in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. Qlik provides an end-to-end, real-time data integration and analytics cloud platform.

title: NOVO application to Knightec Group!
description:
**Thank you for applying to Knightec Group!**

 **Become part of our team and get the opportunity to work with:**

* Project management of projects of various sizes
* Creating concepts and solutions
* Managing client and supplier dialogues
* Development of test labs for future drivetrains
* Robot cells, special machines, and equipment
* Systems for future energy production
* Machine safety
* Sharing knowledge, motivating, and leading others

  

We assist our clients with investment projects, delivery projects, technical feasibility studies, requirements management, concept development, and detailed design. Furthermore, we have the privilege of collaborating with our colleagues in software and hardware development, functional safety, EMC, testing, and product information.

 **An exciting journey with Knightec Group**


Semcon and Knightec have joined forces as Knightec Group. Together, we're forming Northern Europe's leading strategic partner in product and digital service development – how cool is that?


With a unique combination of cross-functional expertise and a holistic business understanding, we support our customers in turning their strategies into reality – from concept to final solution. At Knightec Group, we have the expertise, attitude, and drive needed to take on the most challenging and innovative projects.


With over 2,400 colleagues in Sweden, Norway, and Brazil, we collaborate with industry-leading clients at the intersection of business strategy and technology development to drive tomorrow’s business. Knightec Group offers a full range of services, including hardware, design, software, cloud services, regulations and management. Together, we move people, companies, and society forward.


For our employees, this means incredible opportunities to shape the future through meaningful projects at the cutting edge of technology.


Here, you’ll not only develop and grow, but also become part of something greater.


Does this sound like the place for you? Join us on this exciting journey!


Take care,  

Knightec Group Recruitment Team!

title: Konsultuppdrag | Data Analyst (Senior)
description:
**Om uppdraget**


Är du en passionerad dataanalytiker som drivs av att hitta insikter i stora datamängder? Har du en stark problemlösningsförmåga och vill påverka produktutveckling och strategiska beslut?

* SQL, Python
* Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power BI
* Google Cloud Platform (GCP), BigQuery
* Dataanalys, Datavisualisering, Statistik
* Kundbeteendeanalys, Prediktiv analys
* Webb, TV, Mobil
* Innehållsanalys, Segmentering, AI-driven analys

**Erfarenhet och kvalifikationer**


Vi söker dig som är självgående och initiativrik men som samtidigt trivs i en samarbetsinriktad arbetsmiljö. Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataanalys och en stark förmåga att omvandla data till värdefulla insikter.  

  

Vi ser gärna att du har:

* Gedigen erfarenhet av dataanalys med flera framgångsrika projekt i bagaget.
* Starka analytiska färdigheter och vana att hantera komplexa datamängder från olika källor.
* Erfarenhet av dataanalysverktyg och programmeringsspråk som SQL och Python.
* Kunskap inom datavisualisering (t.ex. Qlik Sense, Tableau, Power BI).
* En nyfiken och proaktiv inställning, med en vilja att testa och verifiera hypoteser.
* God problemlösningsförmåga och uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor.
* Förmåga att driva förändring och anpassa sig till en dynamisk arbetsmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och BigQuery är meriterande.
* 

**On-site (Stockholm)**

**Start: ASAP**

 **Längd: ~4 mån**

 **Om Senterprise**  

*Senterprise Sverige AB är ett ledande nischat IT-rekryteringsbolag med expertis inom rekrytering av erfarna systemutvecklare. Vi hjälper idag några av Sverige mest attraktiva arbetsgivare med IT-rekrytering, uthyrning av rekryteringskonsulter samt IT-konsulter.*  

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: Visual Project Specialist
description:
Would you like to work in an organization where the work you do is meaningful and will have a direct impact on the lives of millions of people and businesses? Our core business is data and how it can be utilized, to help our customers make intelligent decisions. We are together building a culture where we are described by co-workers as friendly, professional and caring and where you are encouraged to challenge yourself.


We are searching for a Stockholm or Helsinki-based, temporary **Visual Project Specialist** until the end of November 2025.


Are you a visually skilled project specialist? Do you enjoy managing projects and ensuring they move forward smoothly? Do you get excited about creating B2B advertisements or renewing PowerPoint presentations? If so, we want to hear from you!

**What will you do?**


You will be part of our Nordic content production team, which includes colleagues in Finland, Sweden and Norway. Our skilled team produces newsletters, articles, customer stories, and brochures, as well as texts for marketing automation, advertising, and websites. In addition to a fantastic team, you will be supported by great partners. A significant part of your daily work will involve collaborating with sales, product owners, and our external partners.

  

Your key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

* Leading our sales materials renewal project in Sweden and Finland. This means identifying the materials to be updated, scheduling meetings with our partners and stakeholders, and providing your expertise on the finalized materials.
* Updating PowerPoint presentations, including product materials, meeting materials, etc.
* Creating a library for all materials to ensure they are easy to find.

**Who are you?**

  

We're looking for a Finnish and Swedish-speaking individual with at least a 3 years of experience in content production, particularly with PowerPoints, print/digital ads and sales materials. You should have a strong visual eye and be proficient in using either Canva or Adobe Creative Cloud tools, as well as PowerPoint. It's also important that you love project management and have a strong capability to drive your own work and projects. In addition to Finnish and Swedish skills, it is an asset that you also know English, since it is our corporate language.


We place great emphasis in personal characteristics and attitudes in our recruitments and are looking for a colleague with excellent collaboration skills and a positive, proactive and enthusiastic attitude.

**Practical information**
  

Type of employment: Temporary until end of November 2025  

Start date: As soon as possible  

Office location: Stockholm or Helsinki

  

The salary for the position ranges from 3 500€ to 4 500€ / month, depending on the experience of the selected person.

**And lastly,** **w****hy us?**

  

We operate in a scalable and digital business with intelligence at the core. We are continuing our exciting journey to become the Nordic knowledge company that powers society with intelligence. Here you will work in an environment with a high development phase where we continuously strive to improve our ways of working and to be innovative in our service development. You would work close to people and businesses with possibilities to make an impact.


We are also proud of the value-based company that we are building together. You would spend your days amongst engaged, caring and competent colleagues that will support and challenge you. And if you do the same, you will make a great colleague. For us, how you act and behave towards your colleagues and external stakeholders is equally important as your competence.

  

If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, our recruiting manager Taija Koskinen will be happy to tell you more. You can reach Taija at +358 40 534 7227 on Tuesday, March 4th, from 13-16.30 EET or Friday, March 12th, from 9-12 EET.

  

We process applications during the application period, so please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than Friday, March 14th, 2025.

  

If you have read this far with excitement and meet the above qualifications, we would love to hear from you. Please press "apply now" and send in your application!


\_\_

 **Curious about the application process?**  

We want to ensure that you as a candidate receive a fair assessment in a recruitment process where all candidates are assessed on equal terms, based on what is relevant to the current role. We use Alva Labs assessments to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role, in addition to interviews and references. For some roles we also apply background checks.

###### ***Equal Opportunity Employer***

*Enento Group is an equal opportunity employer. We promote diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.*

title: Technical Lead
description:
Aurobay develops and produces world-class hybrid engines and transmissions. With factories on two continents - Sweden and China - we're a pioneering global supplier of propulsion technology, development services and contract manufacturing. The Aurobay brand brings together over 9,000 dedicated and determined people that design, develop, and manufacture next-generation powertrain solutions for a global market.


Aurobay is part of HORSE Powertrain Limited, a global leader in powertrain solutions. The Group has 19,000 employees, 17 plants and 5 R&D centers across three continents. We partner with OEM customers around the world and offer innovative solutions that can cater to up to 80% of the growing hybrid and combustion powertrain market, enabling a faster transition toward cleaner mobility.


As a Technical Lead you will develop and manage our digital platforms to enhance our business efficiency, ensuring a seamless digital experience. You will work with a team dedicated to manage the ServiceNow platform and your home will be within our Digital organization.


**Skills and Experience**
* + At least five years of experience in ServiceNow development and architecture.
	+ Deep understanding of cloud-based, event-driven architectures, with a focus on designing scalable and advanced solutions in ServiceNow.
	+ Extensive experience in developing self-service and automation capabilities within the platform.
	+ Expertise in ITSM, HRSD, SecOps, and App Engine best practices.

**Your role at Aurobay**


**As a Technical Lead at Aurobay you will:**

  

* Mentor and provide technical guidance to the team
* Explore and implement improvements in CI/CD, automated testing, and versioning processes.
* Leverage the ServiceNow platform to enhance data-driven decision-making across the organization.
* Contribute to the strategic direction and evolution of our product roadmap
* Engage in dynamic discussions with stakeholders
* Collaborate on maintaining a well-organized product backlog
* Develop, execute and maintain robust, sustainable platform solutions
* Promote and contribute to our agile working culture

**About the Team**


The vast majority of the team is based in our Gothenburg office. This proximity allows us to meet regularly, fostering a strong sense of community and collaboration. Although a few members work remotely, our hybrid setup ensures that everyone is integrated and engaged.
  

Our team is inherently curious and regularly organizes focused days where we come together to work jointly on common topics. These concentrated efforts always help us take significant leaps forward in our work. Additionally, we actively participate in Hackathons with our friends in the broader Digital organization, further enhancing our skills and fostering innovation.

  

**What we offer**


**In addition to a competitive salary,** a great location on Lindholmen or Skövde, and a genuine work-life balance, we provide the following benefits:


* A yearly wellness contribution of SEK 5 000 for your physical and mental wellbeing.
* A personal and professional development scheme to support your growth.
* Additional pension funding.
* Competitive additional and full coverage insurance.

**Equal opportunities employer**


We are an equal opportunities employer. We encourage candidates from underrepresented groups to apply, especially women, people from ethnic minority backgrounds, and people with disabilities. Research has shown that women and people from ethnic minority backgrounds are less likely to apply if they don't match 100% of the criteria. As a company, we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. If you believe you have the skills and passion to excel in this role, we would love to hear from you. Let's explore the possibilities together.


**How to apply**


Deadline to submit your application is **March 15** but the selection process will be running continuously. Please note that due to GDPR, we do not accept applications via email. We can’t wait to see what you can bring to our team!


**Questions**


If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Johan Ström, johan.strom@aurobay.com


For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter Louise Mårdholm, louise.mardholm@aurobay.com


Questions concerning trade union: Unionen: Ordf Joakim Dahlin, joakim.dahlin@aurobay.com,

title: Integrationsspecialist SAP - Repona AB
description:
**Integrationsspecialist SAP – Bli en del av Repona!**


Är du en driven och lösningsorienterad specialist inom SAP-integration? Vill du arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får möjlighet att utveckla våra kunders framtida integrationslösningar? Då har vi jobbet för dig!

**Om rollen**


Som **Integrationsspecialist SAP** hos Repona kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa, utveckla och optimera integrationslösningar för våra kunder. Du kommer arbeta i spetsen av SAP-teknologi, där innovation och kvalitet står i fokus. I rollen kommer du samarbeta med andra IT-specialister, SAP-konsulter och affärsanvändare och som konsult hos oss är du placerad på vårt kontor i Lund eller ute hos kund.


Dina främsta ansvarsområden

* Designa och implementera integrationslösningar i SAP-miljöer
* Arbeta med SAP Integration Suite, PI/PO och API-hantering
* Samarbeta nära våra kunder för att förstå deras affärsbehov och optimera deras processer
* Vara en del av ett erfaret och engagerat team som brinner för innovation och kvalitet

**Vad vi söker**


Vi letar efter en specialist inom SAP Integration Suite som har erfarenhet av att arbeta med integrationer i en hybrid- och molnbaserad miljö. För att lyckas i rollen bör du ha:

* God kunskap om SAP-system, arkitektur och processer för att designa och implementera effektiva integrationsstrategier
* Teknisk expertis inom SAP Cloud Integration (CPI), SAP Process Integration (PI) och SAP Process Orchestation (PO) och andra relevanta teknologier
* Kunskap om API-hantering och erfarenhet av SAP API Management


Som person har du lätt för att kommunicera och kan förklara komplexa tekniska frågor för icke-tekniska teammedlemmar och intressenter. Vidare är du noggrann och har en förmåga att analysera och tolka komplexa data. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av SAP Open Connectors för integration av tredjepartsapplikationer.


**Varför Repona?**

* Vi är en ledande SAP-partner med expertis och hjärta!
* Hos oss får du frihet att påverka, utvecklas och ta egna initiativ
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande kunder och den senaste tekniken
* En arbetsmiljö med högt engagemang, flexibelt arbete och en kultur som uppmuntrar initiativtagande samtidigt som vi värderar en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Attraktiva förmåner som konkurrenskraftig lön, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och andra förmåner som främjar din trivsel och utveckling


Låter det som något för dig? **Ansök nu och bli en del av vårt team!**

**Ansök**


I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Gruffman Recruitment & Consulting. Din ansökan lämnar du via hemsidan **Varmt välkommen! - Gruffman**


Ansök snarast då vi arbetar med löpande urval.


Har du frågor, tveka inte att kontakta Ulrika Gruffman, ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, på **ulrika@gruffman.nu** eller 0733-434189.

title: Microsoft 365-konsult
description:
Är du passionerad för den moderna arbetsplatsen och Microsoft 365? Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att hjälpa företag att optimera sina digitala miljöer? Då kan rollen som Microsoft 365-konsult hos B3 Cloud vara perfekt för dig!  

  



**Om rollen – Din chans att göra skillnad i kunders digitala resa!**

Som Microsoft 365-konsult hos oss kommer du att:

* Definiera, planera och genomföra migreringar till Microsoft 365, samt utveckla och optimera kundernas befintliga miljöer.
* Hantera incidenter och implementera nya lösningar, samtidigt som du håller dig uppdaterad med de senaste uppdateringarna från Microsoft.
* Bygga starka relationer med kunder och kollegor, och fungera som en pålitlig rådgivare i deras digitala transformation.
* Driva teknisk utveckling genom att integrera nya funktioner och uppdateringar i Microsoft 365-plattformen.

**Vi söker dig som…**

* Har minst 4 års erfarenhet inom IT och erfarenhet av Microsoft 365.
* Har tidigare arbetat som konsult och trivs med att förstå och utmana kunders behov på ett konstruktivt sätt.
* Är proaktiv och strukturerad, med ett starkt kundfokus.
* Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Behärskar svenska flytande i både tal och skrift, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.

**Vad vi erbjuder – En arbetsplats där du kan växa och trivas!**

* **En växande organisation** där ditt bidrag är avgörande för vår framgång.
* **En kultur präglad av energi, hjälpsamhet och strävan att göra skillnad**.
* **Flexibilitet** att styra din egen vardag och satsa på din personliga utveckling.
* **Sociala aktiviteter** som årliga konferensresor, sommarfester och julfiranden för att stärka gemenskapen.

**Vem är vi?**

Vi är B3 Cloud, en del av B3 Consulting Group – ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag. Vi hjälper våra kunder att bygga framtidens IT-miljöer genom modern molnteknik och cybersäkerhet. Vi är ett team på cirka 40 experter inom moln och säkerhet**,** och vi älskar att samarbeta, utvecklas och lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans!


**Om B3 Consulting Group**

*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.


*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*  

  

**Låter det spännande?** Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: Industry 4.0 Engineer to GKN Aerospace
description:
**About the company**


GKN Aerospace Sweden is part of GKN Aerospace, which manufactures engine components, aircraft structures, cabin windows, wiring, and much more for many of the world's aircraft. The Aerospace division companies that work with aircraft engine parts together form Engines, and at our facility in Trollhättan, we develop and manufacture advanced components for aircraft and space rocket engines. We also work with engine maintenance.


The company has production facilities in Trollhättan, Kongsberg (Norway), Mexico, and the USA. We also have an engineering office in Bangalore, India, and offices in Stockholm (Public Affairs) and Gothenburg.


Global Technology Center is located in Trollhättan, and for this role, you will be based at Innovatum Science Center.

 **About the role**


As a Senior Industry 4.0 Engineer, you will play a key role in developing and implementing advanced manufacturing solutions at GKN Aerospace’s. Your focus will be on optimizing manufacturing processes and integrating software with shop-floor equipment, including CNC machines and Siemens control systems. Drawing on your experience with CNC-machines, Siemens control systems, and CAD/CAM software.


You will lead technology development projects and collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance digital manufacturing capabilities. While experience in manufacturing engineering is beneficial, we are primarily looking for a candidate with strong software development skills, particularly within Industrial Internet of Things (IIOT) and smart factory solutions.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Lead technology development projects within the Global Technology Center.
* Design and implement software integration with equipments and machines.
* Optimize manufacturing processes, leveraging CNC-machines and CAD/CAM expertise.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams within GKN Engines.
* Take initiative and drive problem-solving efforts to tackle technical challenges.

**Your profile**


To succeed in this role, we believe you have:

* A degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field within 4.0 Industry.
* Hands-on experience with CNC machines, preferably Siemens control systems.
* Knowledge in CAD/CAM software related to machining (preferably Siemens NX).
* Experience in IIOT programming (e.g., Python, Node-Red).
* Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


Additionally, it is highly meritorious if you have:

* Experience with CMM and/or 3D scanning (Zeiss Calypso, Zeiss Inspect).
* Familiarity with MES, PLM, and ERP systems (SAP).
* Knowledge of CAD/CAM for additive manufacturing.
* Background in machine learning, data analytics, or cloud computing for manufacturing optimization.
* Understanding of digital twins, smart factory solutions, and industrial automation.

**Application process**

  

The position starts as a consultancy assignment through Skill. For the right person, there are good opportunities for direct employment with the client after the consultancy period. Selection will be handled continuously, and the position may be filled before the application deadline, so do not wait to apply.


For any questions or concerns, please contact the recruiter, Ben Saeang, at ben.saeang@skill.se or +46 31 380 33 24.


We look forward to your application!

title: Internal Communications Specialist
description:
Hello potential future Oatly employee,


It’s us, the original oat drink company that started in Sweden nearly 30 years ago and we need more brilliant minds to come work with us to keep the momentum going and the oat drink flowing.


Sustainability, health, and transparency are the core values that guide everything we do. Basically, we exist to make it easy for people to eat better and live healthier lives without recklessly taxing the planet’s resources in the process. If you're driven to help us make a positive impact in the world, here's your chance to be a change-maker.


The Internal Communications team is here to inform, engage, and unite our global organization around our mission, values, and business using transparent communications that reflect Oatly’s culture and build trust. This role is designed to assist with the end-to-end execution and delivery of communication plans, content, events, and serve the organization in delivering valuable, accessible information that facilitates awareness and alignment.

**We are looking for an Internal Communications Specialist to join the team for a temporary position from June 2025 to January 2026.**


The role reports to the Director of Global Internal Communications and is based in Malmö, Sweden. No travel will be required.


Please note that all applicants reaching the shortlist will be asked to work on a case study as part of the interview process.


This next section is for all you bullet point lovers out there:

**WHAT WE NEED YOU TO BRING TO THE TABLE:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, Business, or related field.
* 2+ years working in an internal communications role, or similar.
* Experience in creating compelling business communications.
* Comfortable with enterprise software solutions, digital tools, and content creation platforms, such as: Microsoft Office and Teams, intranet platforms and CMS, Monday.com, Adobe Suite, Salesforce Marketing Cloud or similar e-newsletter tooling, web analytics tools.
* Basic knowledge of graphic design is a plus.
* Fluent/native in English; Swedish language is a plus.
* Experience working in a global company is preferable.
* Experience developing communications for an extensive, distributed workforce is a plus.

**WHAT WE NEED YOU TO DO:**

* Assist with the end-to-end execution of communication plans and materials, which may include creating plans, drafting content, writing talking points, proposing ideal channels for communication, obtaining leadership approvals, distributing materials across internal comms channels, and measuring impact.
* Own the curation and creation of content and delivery for our global bi-weekly email newsletter, Time Oat monthly poster newsletter, and ongoing Oatnet content, including planning, writing, and editing content.
* Serve as systems owner for internal comms – taking care of the ongoing development of Oatnet (intranet), e-newsletter (Salesforce Marketing Cloud), PlayIPP (digital signage), and other IC-owned tools.
* Support with delivering onsite events and activations to help employees connect with Oatly’s vision, culture, campaigns, and overall business objectives.
* Support in identifying, planning, and executing key employee engagement opportunities.
* Provide responses to email requests coming through the central team inbox and direct or fulfill any requirements as needed.
* Maintain internal communications templates and tools to empower an organization of autonomous teams and communicators.
* Gather data and report back on the effectiveness of communication efforts.
* Partner with different areas of the business to help them amplify key messages through impactful articles, presentations, newsletter content, and internal messaging.
* Collaborate with external communications to align on messaging and leverage content for cross-channel and cross-audience use.

**WHO WE NEED YOU TO BE:**

* You are experienced and confident in partnering with teams to guide and support in building strong communications and infrastructures that connect, inform and engage the wider organisation.
* You are skilled in orchestrating and producing internal communications and compelling content across various channels and mediums, (including intranet pieces, newsletter content, micro-messaging, live events, digital signage, videos, print).
* You are a passionate advocate of the sustainability agenda who wants to create societal shifts and drive the plant-based revolution

**YOUR APPLICATION:**


As you can probably tell, we’re a norm-breaking company. For us, diversity and differences are an obvious asset. We know that amazing candidates can sometimes be put off applying for a job unless they can tick every box, and that makes us really sad. So please trust your gut and apply if it feels right.

  

We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested, please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there. This will ensure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone!


We kindly ask that you apply in English.

**Apply for the position no later than Wednesday March 12.**  

  

**The Oatly Way**


Oatly is a company built on the idea of change. Our mission is to help people upgrade their everyday lives and the health of the planet by making tasteful oat-based food products accessible to a wider audience. It's why we come to work every day. With head office in Malmö and production in Sweden, Netherlands, China, Singapore, and the US, our products are available in almost 30 countries across Europe, North America, and Asia.

  

#LI-TA1

title: Line Manager Common Product Development
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for a strong leader with broad experience from SW Development.

  

As Development Line Manager within SA BOS Engineering, Product Development Unit (PDU) Cross Solution & Platform, you will be leading a global Development unit with the responsibility of Common Product Development both within BOS and BCSS.

  

You are demonstrating a strong ability for innovation, collaboration and communication to foster cross-functional teamwork and drive cutting-edge solutions, together with result-oriented mindset. Your ability to drive change projects in a global environment is key for success.

  

The position is a line leader role for a unit that is responsible for development of the ADP generic service WCDB based on Cassandra, used in several Commercial Offerings in Ericsson, and BAM development (BOS Application Manager) used by Commercial Offerings within BOS. Our highly competent architecture and development teams are located in Karlskrona and Chennai.

  

Position is open for applicants in Sweden.

 **What you will do:**

 **Operative accountability:**

* Service Owner of ADP WCDB, development, release and support in close collaboration with Indaiatuba WCDB Dev unit
* BAM Chennai development in close collaboration with Karlskrona BAM Dev unit
* Part of Competence hub for Cassandra and supporting organization with Cassandra queries
* Have ownership for deliverables provided by your teams
* Lead transformation activities towards process simplification and efficiency.

 **People accountability:**

* Build strong development teams for today and tomorrow with focus on critical skill competences as AI, cloud, security and technology leadership.
* Secure high performing individuals and team in a global set-up.
* Ericsson leadership framework and Speak-Up are foundation for our leadership and practices.

 **Strategic accountability:**

* Part of PDU Leadership team
* Secure and drive strategic initiatives to secure competitive edge and continuous business value
* Focus on innovation and technology for tomorrow

 **The skills you bring:**

* Master’s or Bachelor´s Degree related to Software Engineering
* Broad experience from SW Development or similar within Ericsson - min 5 years experience
* Experience from multi-cultural, cross-geography and distributed SW development
* Demonstrate strong leadership skills as well as curiosity and willingness to challenge status quo.
* Strong collaboration skills enabling cross teamwork.
* A great interest to coach and make people perform at their best.
* Passion to win and solution-oriented attitude.
* Role model for team by demonstrating high integrity with a strong focus on compliance
* Proof-points from leading transformation and change
* Excellent in time management and master of implementation to a plan
* Strong communication skills
* Fluent in English
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Karlskrona

title: Enterprise Account Executive, Nordics
description:
**The Role:**  

SnapLogic is an industry leader in AI-driven data integration, API management, and enterprise automation. We empower organizations to unlock the full potential of their data, accelerate decision-making, and drive business transformation at scale. Our AgentCreator AI enables enterprises to design, deploy, and scale AI agents that augment human capabilities, streamline complex workflows, and unlock new business opportunities—all within a single, secure platform. Our API Management solutions allow seamless connectivity and governance across cloud, on-premises, and hybrid environments.  

The Enterprise Account Executive role demands a unique blend of credibility, strategic acumen, adaptability, resilience, and relentless drive. Successful candidates possess a proven track record of consistently surpassing sales targets, cultivating a robust pipeline through proactive outbound engagement, innovative prospecting strategies, and unwavering perseverance. Strong negotiation skills, consultative selling expertise, and the ability to foster long-term customer relationships are essential for success in this role.  

You excel in navigating the intricacies of complex enterprise environments, adeptly engaging with multiple stakeholders, including C-suite executives. You have the ability to adapt to evolving market conditions, articulate value propositions effectively, and collaborate cross-functionally. You have demonstrated proficiency in orchestrating high-value, strategic "land and expand" enterprise sales, with a particular emphasis on AI-driven and API-led integration solutions.  

If you’re looking to join a dynamic team that’s redefining integration and automation through AI, apply today!
### **What You'll Do:**

* Prospect into assigned accounts, securing meaningful conversations with key decision-makers.
* Develop and present a comprehensive sales strategy in the allocated territory with a target prospect list and a regional sales plan.
* Articulate and manage SnapLogic's complex sales cycles, positioning the value of our AI-powered AgentCreator, API Management solutions, and full product suite to enterprise decision-makers.
* Develop and manage key relationships throughout assigned strategic accounts, from technical individual contributors to C-level executives.
* Educate prospects on how SnapLogic's AI-driven integration platform accelerates automation, improves operational efficiency, and enhances business agility.
* Practice operational discipline by maintaining accurate opportunity and activity management in Salesforce, while creating satisfied, referenceable customers.

### **What We're Looking For:**

* At least 5 years of selling IT technology solutions, preferably in AI, API management, data integration, or automation.
* Demonstrated success managing complex sales cycles, from business/IT champions to C-level executives.
* Proven track record of consistently meeting and exceeding sales quotas.
* Experience in both SaaS and on-premises solution selling.
* Previous Sales Methodology training, SaaS integration or application experience, and strong customer references preferred.
* A proactive, solution-oriented, independent thinker with the highest levels of intensity and integrity.
* Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills.
* A polished executive presence that exudes credibility.
* Strong negotiation skills with an ability to drive enterprise-level deals.
* Bachelor’s Degree required.
* Experience working in a fast-paced, start-up environment strongly preferred.
* #LI-JT1

**Why Join:**  

There's never been a better time to join our SnapSquad!  

At SnapLogic, we believe our people are the heart of our success. That is why we are dedicated to creating an environment where you can thrive both personally and professionally. From competitive salaries and robust health benefits to global wellness initiatives, we ensure you’re set up for success - wherever you’re based.  

Here’s why you don’t want to miss out on being a part of our team: **A Legacy of Excellence - Recognized Industry Visionary and Leader:**
When it comes to innovation and growth, SnapLogic isn’t just keeping up; we’re setting the pace. Recognized by Inc. 5000 as one of the Fastest Growing Private Companies in 2024, our trajectory speaks volumes. For the third consecutive year, SnapLogic has been named a Visionary in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data Integration Tools, where we’ve been praised for our expanding platform and generative AI innovations. And that’s not all—Aragon Research has highlighted our leadership in the tPaaS Globe Report, calling our generative AI capabilities a major differentiator that puts us ahead of the competition. **Redefining the Integration Category in the Age of AI:**
In an era where enterprises are reimagining themselves as composable, data-driven entities, SnapLogic is at the forefront, unlocking new possibilities through generative AI and AI-augmented, graphical-visual integration. SnapLogic is not just making integration accessible to highly technical experts, but also to business technologists seeking simplicity. SnapLogic’s comprehensive, highly scalable platform transcends traditional boundaries by unifying application and data integration, API management, and automation. It’s not just another iPaaS platform - we’re a catalyst for agility and innovation, enabling businesses to seize the future today. **Innovation at the Forefront:**
SnapLogic was first to market with the world’s only generative integration solution, SnapGPT, empowering users to integrate faster and easier. With open source and proprietary large language models (LLMs) and artificial intelligence, SnapGPT enables users to integrate any applications or data sources with natural language. Since launching SnapGPT in early 2023, SnapLogic has launched a full suite of AI solutions, including AgentCreator which empowers everyone to create GenAI-powered automations and applications without coding. Thousands of enterprises around the globe rely on SnapLogic to integrate, automate and orchestrate their data – across their business and now they’re looking to SnapLogic to help them unlock the next frontier of generative AI. **Join Us on Our Journey**  

At SnapLogic, we're changing the way the world works with data—and we want you to be part of that change. If you're ready to push boundaries, embrace innovation, and lead the charge in transforming industries, we want to hear from you.  

SnapLogic is headquartered in San Mateo, CA, with team members located across the globe. No matter where you’re based, we offer a dynamic, collaborative, and forward-thinking environment that fosters growth, creativity, and success.  

Are you ready to join the SnapSquad and shape the future of generative integration? We can’t wait to see your application!

title: SW Compliance (FOSS) System Architect
description:
**About This Opportunity:**

  

Join our BCSS Core Networks Engineering (CNE) team as we build and operate a cutting-edge Software Production System (SPS). This system empowers Ericsson's R&D in 5G, 6G, and Cloud Native engineering with simple and stable environments, enabling every BCSS engineer to excel. SPS offers essential development and verification services, such as development clouds, telecom networks, and software pipelines, to boost engineering productivity.

  

Are you passionate about driving innovation and agility through cutting-edge technology? Do you have a knack for building secure and compliant systems that give companies a competitive edge? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

  

As a pivotal part of our R&D strategy, 3PP Management—particularly in Free and Open Source Software (FOSS)—empowers BCSS to lead in the industry by delivering innovative solutions at a controlled cost. We are committed to advancing this key area over the coming years, and we're looking for a talented individual to spearhead these efforts as our BCSS 3PP Management Architect.

  

In this dynamic role, you'll lead the design and systemization of architecture and solutions for 3PP Management, including FOSS and Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) products. You'll have the unique opportunity to collaborate with various programs and units within and beyond BCSS, using platform engineering, digital transformation, and AI tools to enhance our software engineering performance and efficiency.

  

Join us and play a crucial role in shaping our future. If you're ready to take on this challenge and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!

 **What You Will Do:**

  

* Lead BCSS 3PP management convergent technical vision and strategy.
* Collaborate with BCSS Product Development Units (PDUs) to identify common needs and opportunities for simplification.
* Foster a collaborative model to engage PDUs in shaping the future of software compliance management.
* Develop solutions that align with BCSS engineering strategies, integrating services from SAN, EIT, and in-house offerings.
* Oversee architecture, design, and implementation of scalable and resilient compliance solutions.
* Guard the preferred and mandatory tools to be used for 3PP Management in BCSS
* Support strategic discussions and requirements for evolving compliance solutions.
* Leverage AI and platform engineering to improve compliance solutions.
* Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies.

 **The Skills You Bring:**

  

* Master's degree or equivalent experience in a technical field.
* Over 10 years of experience in software development and R&D.
* Strong understanding of Cloud Native development, including continuous design and deployment.
* Expertise in FOSS and COTS management tools and processes.
* Proven track record of leading technological and cultural changes in large organizations.
* Excellent technical leadership aligned with Ericsson's core values.
* Broad experience with Ericsson's product portfolio and an understanding of PDU needs.
* Ability to inspire new ways of working and set high standards.
* Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent in English.

**Join our Team**
-----------------

title: Senior Hybrid Infrastructure Engineer
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   





 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Global Cloud Infrastructure Team is seeking a skilled Hybrid Cloud Operations Engineer to join our international team. As part of this dynamic team, you will play a key role in supporting our commercial offerings. Unit4 operates a sophisticated infrastructure spanning Microsoft Azure and on-premises data centers in Sweden. In this role, you will primarily work with Windows Server Virtual Machines deployed on VMware while also assisting in the setup of virtual networks and Azure native solutions.
   

  

  




**Qualifications**

**Required:**



* 5+ years of relevant experience
* Deep knowledge of Windows Server architecture and Active Directory
* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure
* Minimum 4 years experience with VMware and virtualization technologies
* Experience automating Windows systems using PowerShell or similar methods
* Hands-on experience with physical data centers, including cabling, moving components, etc.
* Flexibility to work outside of office hours and participate in weekend on-call support.
* Strong prioritization skills, both independently and as part of a team
* Proficient troubleshooting skills, with the ability to resolve complex issues
* Passion for learning new technologies and exploring innovative ideas
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for engaging with internal and external customers



**Nice to Have:**



* Familiarity with Microsoft Azure & Microsoft certifications
* Experience with Dell Servers, Cisco Network devices
* Knowledge of networking (VPN setup), file transfer servers, Microsoft SQL, and PKI infrastructure
* Experience with AWS


**Additional Information**

 A chance to participate in the development of a leading global software firm. You have the opportunity to work within an organization, that gives you the freedom and autonomy to be successful. An attractive salary while working in a challenging international environment with enthusiastic colleagues who like to learn from each other.
   





 At Unit4 we invest in your personal and professional growth. We don't focus on how many days you work, we trust you on delivering results - thus, we have an unlimited vacation policy.
   





**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**
